00040 #ifndef __OCTEON_PCI_CONSOLE_H__
00041 #define __OCTEON_PCI_CONSOLE_H__
00042 
00043 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00044 #include "cvmx-platform.h"
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 /* Current versions */
00048 #define OCTEON_PCI_CONSOLE_MAJOR_VERSION    1
00049 #define OCTEON_PCI_CONSOLE_MINOR_VERSION    0
00050 
00051 #define OCTEON_PCI_CONSOLE_BLOCK_NAME   "__pci_console"
00052 
00053 /* Structure that defines a single console.
00054 
00055 * Note: when read_index == write_index, the buffer is empty.  The actual usable size
00056 *       of each console is console_buf_size -1;
00057 */
00058 typedef struct {
00059     uint64_t input_base_addr;
00060     uint32_t input_read_index;
00061     uint32_t input_write_index;
00062     uint64_t output_base_addr;
00063     uint32_t output_read_index;
00064     uint32_t output_write_index;
00065     uint32_t lock;
00066     uint32_t buf_size;
00067 } octeon_pci_console_t;
00068 
00069 /* This is the main container structure that contains all the information
00070 about all PCI consoles.  The address of this structure is passed to various
00071 routines that operation on PCI consoles.
00072 */
00073 typedef struct {
00074     uint32_t major_version;
00075     uint32_t minor_version;
00076     uint32_t lock;
00077     uint32_t flags;
00078     uint32_t num_consoles;
00079     uint32_t pad;
00080     /* must be 64 bit aligned here... */
00081     uint64_t console_addr_array[0]; /* Array of addresses of octeon_pci_console_t structures */
00082     /* Implicit storage for console_addr_array */
00083 } octeon_pci_console_desc_t;
00084 
00085 /* Flag definitions for octeon_pci_console_desc_t */
00086 enum {
00087     OCT_PCI_CON_DESC_FLAG_PERCPU = 1 << 0,  /* If set, output from core N will be sent to console N */
00088 };
00089 
00090 #if defined(OCTEON_TARGET) && !defined(__linux__)
00091 /**
00092  * This is an internal-only function that is called from within the simple executive
00093  * C library, and is not intended for any other use.
00094  *
00095  * @param fd
00096  * @param buf
00097  * @param nbytes
00098  *
00099  * @return
00100  */
00101 int __cvmx_pci_console_write(int fd, char *buf, int nbytes);
00102 #endif
00103 
00104 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00105 uint64_t octeon_pci_console_init(int num_consoles, int buffer_size);
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 /* Flag definitions for read/write functions */
00109 enum {
00110     OCT_PCI_CON_FLAG_NONBLOCK = 1 << 0, /* If set, read/write functions won't block waiting for space or data.
00111                          * For reads, 0 bytes may be read, and for writes not all of the
00112                          * supplied data may be written.*/
00113 };
00114 
00115 #if !defined(__linux__) || defined(__KERNEL__)
00116 int octeon_pci_console_write(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num, const char *buffer, int bytes_to_write, uint32_t flags);
00117 int octeon_pci_console_write_avail(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num);
00118 
00119 int octeon_pci_console_read(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num, char *buffer, int buffer_size, uint32_t flags);
00120 int octeon_pci_console_read_avail(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num);
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 #if !defined(OCTEON_TARGET) && defined(__linux__) && !defined(__KERNEL__)
00124 int octeon_pci_console_host_write(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num, const char *buffer, int write_reqest_size, uint32_t flags);
00125 int octeon_pci_console_host_write_avail(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num);
00126 
00127 int octeon_pci_console_host_read(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num, char *buffer, int buf_size, uint32_t flags);
00128 int octeon_pci_console_host_read_avail(uint64_t console_desc_addr, unsigned int console_num);
00129 #endif
00130 #endif
